intro: Anemia pumila, commonly known as the dwarf anemone, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features a compact rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves that are covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white during the spring and early summer. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a preference for well-drained, rocky soils. Anemia pumila is often cultivated in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
